title: Non-place" is chosen to invite comparison of the places cited in Le Testament to what Marc Auge calls non-lieux of our age. The latter are zones to which one gains access but that are uninhabitable. "Places" have identitarian value, and are relational and historical in quality, whereas the non-place resists anthropological analysis and, contrary to Baudelairean modernity, "does not integrate older places

ANDRZEJ PIOTROWSKI is associate professor in the College of Architecture and Landscape Architecture at the University of Minnesota. He is coeditor, with Julia Williams Robinson, of the forthcoming Discipline of Architecture
He focuses on the interconnections between representation, epistemology, and architectural design and is currently working on a book tentatively titled Space and Image
